summary: This document is a set of 30-minute check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated July 1, 2019. The sheets record staff observations of inmates in locked-down status, following a protocol requiring checks at least twice per hour. The sheets are reviewed by a Lieutenant and Captain.

events.title: Daily Inmate Observation Checks
events.description: Routine 30-minute observation checks of inmates in the Special Housing Unit (administrative detention or disciplinary segregation) at MCC New York, as documented on standardized log sheets.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a prison log sheet detailing 30-minute observation checks of inmates in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York.
The checks were conducted on July 1, 2019, and follow a strict protocol requiring inmates in locked-down status to be observed at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The log sheets were reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain, indicating standard prison operational procedures.
The document is part of the Epstein case files, suggesting it relates to the period when Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated at MCC New York prior to his death.
